ingredients: Pickled vegetables (pickled carrots, daikon, or cabbage)
Salt and white pepper to taste
Optional: fried shallots, chili oil, cilantro
instructions: Rinse rice until water runs clear
In a large pot, bring broth, water, and ginger to a boil
Add rice, reduce heat to low
Simmer uncovered for 1-1.5 hours, stirring occasionally
Cook until rice breaks down and porridge reaches desired consistency
Add more water if needed for thinner consistency
Season with soy sauce, sesame oil, salt and white pepper
Prepare pickled vegetables on the side
Serve hot porridge garnished with chopped scallions
Serve pickled vegetables on the side
Optional: add fried shallots, chili oil, or cilantro as toppings

ingredients: 4 tbsp natural peanut butter (creamy or chunky)
Optional: chia seeds or granola for topping
instructions: Choose ripe but firm bananas (some brown spots are good)
Peel bananas and slice into rounds or leave whole for dipping
Place peanut butter in a small bowl for dipping or spread on banana slices
Optional: drizzle with honey for extra sweetness
Optional: sprinkle with cinnamon
Optional: top with chia seeds or granola for crunch
Serve immediately for best texture

ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Bring a pot of salted water to boil
Cut guanciale into small cubes or slices
Cook guanciale in a skillet over medium heat for 2-3 minutes until crispy, remove from heat and set aside
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated Pecorino Romano, and plenty of black pepper until creamy
Cook spaghetti al dente according to package instructions
Drain spaghetti, reserving some pasta water
Place spaghetti in the skillet with the guanciale over high heat to coat with rendered fat
TURN OFF THE HEAT completely
Pour egg and cheese mixture over hot pasta and stir quickly - the residual heat will create a creamy sauce
If too thick, add a splash of pasta water to loosen
Serve immediately, topped with extra guanciale, grated Pecorino Romano, and black pepper
recipe.source: Recipes from Italy - Authentic Roman Carbonara

ingredients: 2 cups milk (dairy, almond, or oat milk)
1/2 cup mixed nuts (walnuts, almonds, pecans), chopped
Fresh berries or sliced banana for topping (optional)
Butter or extra honey for drizzling (optional)
instructions: Combine oats, milk, water, and salt in a medium saucepan
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally
Reduce heat to low and simmer 5-7 minutes until oats are soft and creamy
Remove from heat, stir in vanilla if using
Stir in honey and cinnamon
Divide oatmeal into serving bowls
Top generously with chopped nuts
Add fresh berries or sliced banana if desired
Drizzle with extra honey or butter if you like
Serve warm

recipe.title: Fried tofu cubes
instructions: Prepare ingredients according to standard cooking methods
Cook until done
Season to taste
Serve hot

ingredients: 2 tbsp tomato paste or 1 cup tomato juice
Optional: 1/2 cup cooked beef or sausage
instructions: Heat butter or oil in a large pot over medium heat
Sauté onion until softened, 5 minutes
Add carrot, cook 3 more minutes
Add garlic, cook 30 seconds
Add tomato paste, cook 1 minute
Add broth, beets, potato, and sugar
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, simmer 20 minutes
Add cabbage and vinegar, cook 10 more minutes until vegetables are tender
Optional: add cooked beef or sausage
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Ladle into bowls
Top with a generous dollop of sour cream
Garnish with fresh dill
Serve hot with crusty bread

ingredients: 1/4 cup cheese, shredded (cheddar, feta, or your choice)
instructions: Crack eggs into a bowl, add milk or cream, whisk until well combined
Season with salt and pepper
Heat butter in a non-stick pan over medium heat
Add onion and bell pepper, sauté for 2-3 minutes until softened
Add mushrooms, cook 2 more minutes
Add spinach, cook until just wilted (30 seconds)
Pour egg mixture over vegetables
Gently push eggs across pan with a spatula, letting uncooked egg flow underneath
Continue cooking, stirring gently, until eggs are set but still creamy (about 2-3 minutes)
Remove from heat while slightly undercooked (they'll continue cooking)
Fold in shredded cheese
Garnish with fresh herbs if desired
Serve immediately while hot

recipe.title: Seaweed snacks
instructions: Prepare ingredients according to standard cooking methods
Cook until done
Season to taste
Serve hot

ingredients: 1 cup sour cream or crème fraîche
instructions: Freeze cabbage heads for 2-3 days, then thaw overnight in fridge
Cook rice in boiling water for 5 minutes (al dente), drain
Sauté onion in olive oil until tender, 7-10 minutes
Mix beef, pork, parsley, onions, carrots, rice, salt and pepper
Mix sauce ingredients in a bowl, set aside
Remove cabbage leaves from heads, cut thick ribs
Place 2 tbsp filling at wide end of leaf, fold sides in and roll up
Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C)
Pour some sauce on bottom of casserole dish
Layer cabbage rolls, adding bay leaves and sauce halfway
Pour remaining sauce over rolls, cover
Bake for 1.5-2 hours until tender
Serve with extra sour cream if desired

recipe.title: Steamed buns with pork
instructions: Prepare ingredients according to standard cooking methods
Cook until done
Season to taste
Serve hot

instructions: Prepare ingredients according to standard cooking methods
Cook until done
Season to taste
Serve hot

instructions: Prepare ingredients according to standard cooking methods
Cook until done
Season to taste
Serve hot
